description: I came here on a Sidewalk Food Tour and was delighted by this gem. I just had the best falafel wrap of my life. The flatbread was wonderfully thin, the falafel and veggies were fresh and the owner was very kind. I have roamed Valencia up and down a few times and was surprised that I had never noticed this mom and pop restaurant. I will definitely be back.
author: Maritza M.

description:
Ali Baba's Cave is a dilemma many people who frequent restaurants may have experienced: an average/below average food experience with great customer service.

I ordered a lamb Shish Kebab plate to-go which the lady at the register very happily explained and rang up. Both employees were very helpful and friendly. However the actual dining experience was rather unexceptional. The lamb on my kebab was poorly seasoned, burnt, and very dry. It felt like eating college dining hall grilled chicken all over again, if I wanted that, I could've just stayed for summer school. The sides and condiments were ok, nothing too special with the hummus or the salad, and the rice was decently cooked. For 15 dollars, this meal definitely has a lot but be warned it may leave your mouth drier than the Sahara!
author: Andy J.

description:
Don't waste your time and money going anywhere else for Mediterranean. This is hands down the best spot in town. I've traveled to 3 different continents and can say that I never had falafel this good. 
The staff is amazing, they're friendly, polite and dedicated. You can see the dedication in the food. If you're crazy about Mediterranean like I am, you will love this place, it's AUTHENTIC food, great prices and lovely staff. Highly recommend this place for anyone who loves great Mediterranean food! You'll never want to eat Mediterranean anywhere else! Absolutely love Ali Baba's Cave
author: Constanza D.

description:
This place is truly horrible! First of all, we didn't quite get what we exactly ordered and what they did gave us - the labels were incorrect. In the Chicken Sandwich Shawarma, there were 3 bones! 

Lastly, you couldn't pick up the wrap because everything just fell apart. 

Don't waste your time ordering at this restaurant. You are better off ordering from somewhere else.
author: jeremie m.

description: It was very good lamb shawarma, meat was good quality and moist, spices were good and the pita was fresh. Prices were a good value.
author: Laurence S.

description:
It wasn't a dark and stormy night. But it was for me. As I sat at a table in The Chapel, grumpy that they weren't serving food that night, I realized I needed dinner. With a concert set to start in a few minutes, time was short.

We had passed Ali Baba's on the way to the concert venue, and as hungry as I was, the smell nearly overcame me. Now it could no longer be resisted. Wifey in tow, we set off.

Two shwarma sandwiches were ordered and came loaded with hummus, fries (!), veggies, and spicy paste. Extra spicy for me, please! Piles of lamb were sliced from the terrifying yet hypnotic meat cylinder of awesome, it was wrapped in lavosh, and grilled. 

I've already admitted that i was hungry at that point. (past 9pm, and I hadn't eaten lunch or dinner). But I absolutely INHALED that thing. Not because I was hungry, but because it was DELICIOUS. Grilling the sliced meat after slicing gave each piece a nice seared crust, but was still juicy and tender inside. Hot condiment used was really good, gave the shwarma a nice heat that I really enjoyed.

By the time I was done (less than five minutes!) my hunger was sated. I went back to the concert a happy man, and enjoyed the show. Slightly disappointed that when I came back out, they were closed because I would have really been tempted to go back for another one.

Is it perfect? Nope. But a damn tasty spot in a place where your other option is one of 5,000 burrito joints.
author: Gary E.

description:
I'm always stoked when I get to eat at Ali Baba's Cave. I would eat there years ago when I was living in a theatre around the corner, and didn't have a kitchen (or much money), and even now, the food is consistently good.
I love the babganoj and the fresh falafel (they'll make them fresh for you to go if you call ahead!), and even day old, half eaten sandwiches are great!
author: Loretta S.

description:
First time having a chicken shawarma so I'm not sure what a good shawarma would be but this place was GOOD. It had chicken, red onions, potatoes, french fries, and many more ingredients in it!

It was a delicious meal and I couldn't be any more satisfied. Thanks Ali Baba's Cave!
author: Julian Y.

description:
Ooooh Ali Baba, you satisfied my crave of a gyro sandwich. I was a bit skeptical stepping into this place, but quickly all my doubts vanished.

I ordered a gyro sandwich with everything including hot sauce. It came with hummus, French fries, gyro meat, hot sauce and a few other things that I can't quite remember right now.
The sandwich was very tasty, however, I do have one complaint, it was wrapped in lavash bread. I really wish they made laffa style bread here, it would make everything so much better.

Ali Baba is a great place to grab a quick bite and satisfy your Mediterranean sandwich cravings.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
I was hanging out at the Chapel when I decided I needed to step out to get a snack somewhere else. I decided to get something at this spot. I got the chicken shawarma sandwich. It was pretty large. I saved the other half for lunch the next day. Staff was friendly and the wrap was pretty good.

1.234 review.
author: Denise C.

description: I love this place. The best falafel and hummus hands down- plus they have great prices.
author: Bridget A.

description:
This hole in the wall, run-down looking restaurant proved to be one of the most satisfying, delicious, and authentic Greek meals I have ever had. My stomach was aching with hunger after a long road trip, and I only looked for the cheapest looking, somewhat appetizing food to satisfy this hunger. Wow, did I get more than that! 

As soon as I walked in, I was greeted with fierce "hello's!" from the workers, and my eye immediately went to the subway-style bar with the cooked lamb in the back. 
I ordered the Chicken Shararma (I typically avoid dark meat), and watched as the fresh hummus, steak fries, combination of potatoes and peppers were lathered on the tortilla type bread. As she rolled it up, my mouth began to water at the though of putting the freshly cooked season chicken concoction in my mouth. To make things even better, she put the whole thing in an PANINI PRESS. DAMN what a great greek burrito (as I like to call it). I could only finish half of the $10 meal, and I stayed full for the rest of my day in San Francisco. Highly recommend if you need a single meal to both satisfy your tastebuds and keep you full for most (if not the entire) day.

Also for tourists! The eatery is only a few blocks from Dolores Park. It's a great place to enjoy the Shawarma with a view.
author: Danielle D.

description: This place needs to fill up up and away ! Food was outstanding!!!! I truly cannot believe how savoring every cm of the food was. If it were to look a tad bit modern this place would be smoking hot and trendy!! The manager is so sweet as well and truly all the workers are passionate !! I cannot wait to return six hours later up north for this cave
author: Kathy A.

description: I ordered lentils n brown rice with falafels and another side of yellow rice with mixed veggies. My boo ordered a chicken shawarma...it's so good, authentic n a warm setting. I will definitely be back.
author: Isis M.

description:
Just came out of Veo & looking for a quick stop to grab some lunch to go.  Enter Ali Baba's Cave

Tried the Super Falafel Wrap & the Mr said it was among the best to date. Their "super" wraps are made w/ french fries, eggplant, smooshed falafels, hummus, onion....weird combo but it totally worked!  Might be good to get more hot sauce next time

Also tried their Veggie Ohzi & it was very interesting - nicely seasoned veggies & rice w/ a lovely cinnamon undertone, all wrapped up in a pastry shell.  We'd totally get this again!

What a happy hole-in-the-wall discovery & one we look forward to repeating.....often!
author: Adrienne G.

description: I come here almost once a week and get flafel and shwrma which are my favorites, the staff is very nice , prices are good and the food is clean and delicious
author: Ahoo G.

description:
This used to be one of our favorite places and weused to frequent it regularly (I previously gave it 5 stars), but we had a very bad experience recently (issues with both food and service).

The chicken shawarma meat was way over cooked (meaning on two occasions, I was worried I was biting into a wooden toothpick or something, but it turned out to be dried out, hardened chicken).  The shawarma also had an unusual smell.  It was pretty gross.  

Additionally, when I asked for the tahini on the side, the guy who was working there seemed annoyed and first said he couldn't do it, but then later reconsidered.  Also, when I asked for eggplant on my shawarma, his response was "it's extra" and then after I said "that's fine" he responded with "it's 75 cents extra," and I again had to say "no problem" before he would add it.

Ugh - so disappointing.
author: Barnali D.

description: I have been to this place twice now and will definitely be back.  It's not a fancy place but the food is really great.  I would say their tabouli is some of the best I have had.  The hummus is smooth and silky and the dolmas are great too!  The people are friendly and the service is super quick.  Both times I went I was in the area for a concert at the Chapel, and only had a little time.  We got a great meal for under $30 for 2 people and we were in and out in about 25 minutes.
author: Elisabeth F.

description: I want to love this place, but it's a little too pricey, and the quality of food just isn't there for that price point. For $10, you can get a deluxe falafel wrap with everything in it (add another $2 for a meat option). While the food is decent, the portions are tiny. You get a small dollop of hummus and red sauce and then 4 smashed falafels (to better fit the wrap), a couple of fries, a few slices of grilled eggplant, and some veggies and cilantro. Not only is all this already pre-made, but it's ladled onto your wrap cold, not to-order. Now, you do get this placed on a heating grill to seal the lavash wrap, but this is a poor substitute for having hot food at this price. I'm out.
author: Danny C.

description: First time coming here, and it is awesome. Super tasty gyro with chicken shawarma. They make it spicy with all the fillings, and it hits the spot. Quick service, nice guys. Will come again!!
author: Giana S.

description:
Ali Baba's Cave was in plainsight but passed them by. walked a few blocks, discovered only pricey Salvadorean eats on mission. returned. found more pricey eateries on Valenci..

eats: iamb/beef schwarma (8.95)
-contains french fries, grilled eggplant, chili, hummus, tahini sauce, onions,parsley, beef/chicken sliced from split and grilled.
-first and last time eating chili in schwarma
-huge sammie, not much dripping till the end.
remember to get napkin out from under. i didn't, found it soaked later
4.5 stars, amongst best ever tasted.

take outs:
-11.95 gets u meat with salad, 2 sides, and a piece of lavash bread.
fab value. small room for seating inside.
-one older gentleman does it all. slowly, methodical, courteous, semi-cheerful
-everything looked fresh, sides, 4ish.
author: Victor G.

description: The lamb and beef shawarma is amazing. I usually get the chicken shawarma but wanted to try the lamb and it was amazing.
author: Talissa C.

description:
From an expert in middle eastern food: 
This hippie place has
1- amazing falafel sandwich: ask him not to add onion though. Try it with the fries and eggplants. 

2- unhealthy but great lamb shawarma sandwich: ask him not to add hummus to it. 

They need to work on the interior of the place. It looks so ghetto and dim, hence the title "cave".
author: Ahmad A.

description: Real ppl. Great service. Funky authentic place. A must if you're looking for falafel!
author: Philmore B.

description:
It's no secret.

I have a shameless addiction to Mediterranean food.

It's one of those things I can never get sick of. No matter how many falafels get stuffed in my face, I will always have an unceasing craving for more. 

And I blame this fiery love of falafels on genetics (of course). My father has been fervidly feeding my falafel addiction since I was a wee young'n, and amid the wide selection of Mediterranean cuisine in the bay area, Ali Baba's has always been our favorite place for that good good, hands down. I honestly have a hard time trying other places because I've already found perfection at Ali Baba's.

They earn a dazzling five stars in my book because, well...

*FALAFELS are the bombdizzles. Try it try it try it. They're huge and delicious! Definitely worth the moolah. One bite and you'll look like that one emoji with the heart eyes, yadamean. 

*The WRAPS are made to order right in front of your very eyes (O.O) You can let them know exactly what you want, or don't want, inside of your magical creation! No hot sauce? Extra red onions? No problem. The homies at Ali Baba's gotchu covered.

*Everything is S P R E A D so evenly it's ridiculous. None of that sloppy nonsense. It's amazing.  Plenty of eggplant, potatoes, tabouleh, hot sauce, hummus, tahini and falafel throughout the entire wrap. Major props, Ali Baba.

*Their beef, chicken, and lamb are solid choices. The beef is well marinated and tender. The chicken and lamb aren't super juicy, but not dry either. I personally think the beef/lamb combo is the best choice among the three.

*Such friendly servers. They're always happy to move a table and a set of chairs outside for us when I bring my doggy with me.

*Fast service! Shouldn't take more than ten minutes to grab a quick bite, even with a line of customers. Yee!

Bottom line.

I heart falafels. Especially from Ali Baba's. It's a love that will stand the test of time, and will truly never fade.
author: Noimee L.

description:
My favorite place for falafels and shawarmas!
They got the best here, I come here often and food is fresh and flavorful.
I have tried other places but they are number one for mediterranean cuisine!!
author: Mon G.

description:
love this place!  Was shopping right across the street when my cousin told me to stop by Ali Baba's Cave to pick up a wrap before we go biking.  Great food for on-the-go!  Still delicious even when the food gets cold later.  

I got the beef and lamb shawarma wrap + eggplant (eggplant is a must...delicious and makes it extra moist).  very flavorful overall :)
author: Jaimie W.

description:
love this place - it's perfect for something healthy and delicious + when you need something quick. 

The owner is also super sweet and throws in a falafel! Nice to be recognized as a loyal customer :) 

I do wish they still had the pillows around the table in the back. That was fun to bring someone new there and sit there for dinner.
author: A K.

description:
Best lamb/beef shawermas!

I never miss coming in for a shawerma when I'm in the area. They're huge! I always share half of mine. They're about $8 and some cents. The hot sauce they use is so spicy, yet so addicting. The meat and toppings are always fresh and tasty.

There's a good amount of seating. I absolutely love the side seating area that is lowered, makes it a fun experience. 

Don't miss out!
author: Christina O.

description: Best falafel sandwiches I've had in a long time! I love it. Their prices are decent for such big sandwiches. Workers there are very nice. Recommend this place!
author: Zamen A.

description: I never write restaurant reviews but I feel I have a social obligation here. I've never eaten at this restaurant, however I was walking by it late last night with some friends after they were closed and we noticed a ton of rats running all over the floors and counters. If you don't believe me, I posted two photos of those little guys. DO NOT EAT HERE.
author: Jon T.

description: Ali Baba's is the closest Mediterranean food restaurant to my grandmas cooking. Their food is amazing and traditional. The falafel wrap is the best thing to get here. I get mine with out tahini salad and instead tabuhle. So delicious. My friends who have a really plain palette have let me take them here and they love it so much. Delicious food. Thank you Ali Baba
author: Megan I.

description: When in SF in the Mission District and craving a chicken Shwarma...this is the go to spot! Been coming here for years!!
author: Michelle M.

description:
Eh, it was just okay. I had their chicken shawarma sandwich & I loooove chicken shawarma... It was pretty disappointing,
It was too acidic for my palate.
With all the great restaurants in Mission to try, I won't be going back.
author: Ashley G.

description:
Falafel wrap is ok.  The falafel was dry today...what makes the wrap taste good is the balance of flavors after adding the other items (hummus, chili sauce, onions, parsley, cucumber salad, and fries...yes fries in the wrap).  It all comes together nicely...but really just alright.  Not sure why so many people recommend it without the onions.  It certainly adds to the overall flavor.

Could easily be four star if I was stoned or drunk.
author: Zoran L.

description: We sampled this place on a food tour. It was one of the few places that was welcoming enough to allow a group of 15 sit and enjoy their rolls and use their bathrooms. The food we had and what was on offer was pretty good. It will be worth coming back and trying more of their menu.
author: Sue L.

description:
Best falafel wrap ever. Their food is art, and they are extremely friendly. 

I will be back, often.
author: Patrick A.

description:
Over the years, I have built an immunity toward really bad drunk food decisions. For the most part, my palette is incredibly forgiving when I am inebriated. Well, let me tell you that no amount of alcohol could mitigate the awful, awful drunk meal I had here.

I ordered a chicken shawarma to go. Upon returning to my hotel room, I unwrapped a seemingly hard wrap. The wrap had somehow magically harden on its trip home.  I bit into the shawarma and was slightly horrified to find that the chicken was an alarmingly, unnatural orange color. I took, maybe, two more bites? But everything about the wrap was disgusting. It lacked flavor, the filling was one giant mush, and everything about this wrap was bad, bad, bad. So bad.

Oh my. I would never come back.
author: Trung N.

description:
Shawerma plate is absolutely delicious. It comes with rice, hummus, and a side salad of your choice. We got falafel on the side. I really liked how crispy the falafel is. 

Decent portion size. Great price. And quick service. I would definitely come again.
author: Cynthia T.

description:
The outside doesn't look too appealing and to be honest the inside isn't much of a gem either, but the food speaks for itself.  This restaurant serves some great Mediterranean food, but the quest for the world's best Falafal is still on.

The Falafal here isn't bad.  It just isn't all that good either.  Being deep fried to death with a THICK outer layer that's hard to break through, it's easy to understand why your food is served with a fork.  The pita bread was good but not sure if it was homemade as the consistency in size seemed too similar.  The hummus was amazing, but find me a bad hummus and we'll chat.  The tabouli was probably the best thing on the dish as I ate it up with a spoon.

I think the best and most unique piece about this restaurant is the "Cave".  There is a small cove where seats are on the floor and drapes surround you with light from above.  If you want something a little different try to score a spot in there and wait around for your 3 wishes.
author: Kevin J.

description:
This place was voted the best Falaffel in SF and while it was good the interior was less than to be desired...They have a cool little back area with comfy pillows and such but the table is falling apart and its a little musty and unclean. 

I would say grab this food to go and enjoy at home.
author: Loryn F.

description: Horrible experience--the staff continually gave the hardcase stare to both me and my girlfriend (apparently for the sin of ordering food in their restaurant); harassed me for using their bathroom and were thoroughly rude  to both of us throughout our visit.  I'm not sure if they dislike lesbians, Trans women or both, but either way---not coming back.
author: Christina D.

description: Supposedly voted the best falafel in San Francisco but we would not go back for it. It was ok.
author: Janell S.

description:
Mmm....shawarma. The hamburgers of the middle-east (or the burritos of the middle-east -- take your pick).

Ali Baba's Cave has these awesome wraps that takes all that is good and holy about the dish and combines it into a neat little package for around $8. I love how they cook the meat right in front of you -- not too shabby. It was definitely fresh, but way too "drippy." They got a little too sauce-happy with mine, so make sure to ask for less of the stuff on your visit.
author: Casey S.

description: Was a-ok food. Kinda grubby environment. They forgot one of party member's food and we had to go chase them down.
author: Daniel E.

description:
This is the BEST SHAWERMA/falafel place I have been to in the San Fran area. Must try. 

Young man who runs the place is a good guy and the food is authentic.
author: Hanini B.

description: Delicious food and very friendly service. Come here for a quick and healthy lunch or grab something to go.
author: Anna I.

description: Do not waste your money here like I just did getting the worst Shawerma Wrap of my life! I just wish i wasnt so upset to give a proper feedback. It's just sad
author: Luski G.

description:
This place is amazing. First, the staff is incredibly welcoming and generous. 

More important than friendliness is the food. My god, the food. I must say, this is perhaps the best middle eastern food I've ever had. It's so fresh, so delicious, so mouth watering... I can't wait to go back!!
author: Ian C.

description:
We stopped here on our food walking tour to try their award winning falafel. Evidently they have won best falafel 9 out of the last 10 years!  Not being a fan of falafel I was still impressed with the super crispy crunch and nutty flavor.

This place pretty much looks like a dive but the food was good and the staff is friendly.
author: Douglas Y.

description: Worst shawarma ever!!! Half of it was parsley - I like parsley, but not in industrial quantities. When I ordered I was not prompted to specify a spiciness level - it ended up being too spicy to comfortably enjoy.
author: Stef L.

description: I honestly will never eat here. I've seen so many rats running around at night when the restaurant is closed. They also leave their fries, fried eggplant and sauce out overnight by the rats. Lovely
author: Iza C.

description: I always get their super falafel wrap (only dfference is eggplant), and it's always amazing! I've been here at least three times and have yet to have a negative experience. It gets busy pretty quickly around lunch time, so I recommend coming in early if you can.
author: Nicole F.

description:
I'm a creature of habit. At my favorite places, I order the same thing nearly each and every time. Same combinations, same substitutions, same everything. A lot of the places I call for take-out or delivery recognize me just by my phone order.

At Ali Baba's cave, it's always a shawarma wrap with PRECISELY these ingredients:

Hummus
Tabbouleh
Potatoes
Eggplant
Lamb-and-beef shawarma meat
Tahini

Nothing more, nothing less. I feel no need to experiment any further now that I've found the perfect (for me) combination of utter deliciousness. Bright, fresh hummus and tabbouleh; non-greasy potato strips that pick up the flavors of the ingredients around them; smoky, grilled eggplant; seasoned meat with the perfect char and chew; and tart tahini...all tightly-wrapped in a lavash that is crisped on the grill so that it doesn't get soggy even if you eat it the next day (which I just finished doing).

Since I'm a creature of habit, it's probably not surprising that I'm also one of those people who likes their ingredients neatly incorporated rather than slapped together. So I especially appreciate that the guys here take the time to EVENLY spread the various fillings along the lavash so that I can get each flavor in every bite.

Maybe next time I'll throw caution to the wind and add onions or hot sauce. 

Maybe.

Oh, who am I kidding. If it ain't broke, don't fix it!
author: Valeria R.

description: I had the lamb shawerma and my husband had the shawerma platter. Both were good! Not too special, there are better restaurants in SF. Employees were slow and borderline lazy! I didn't care much for the decor and is in need of a major renovation!
author: Noor S.

description:
Found this place  bc the other eatery was closed.  What a great find this is.  The falafels are the one the best and hummus is delicious.

Falafels (a la carte)  $2.99 you get 4 with a scoop of hummus A+
Lamb and beef swarmma $8.95.  A+

A small in eatery with very reasonable prices and the food is delicious and fresh.  The sitiing area and tables can use some improvement as it is dark and not inviting to want to eat there.

Staff is nice.  Definitely worth returning for their food!
author: Nanana A.

description:
ALI BABA'S CAVE
Excellent Middle Eastern fare in the city. Great place for a quick bite. Excellent baked goods and meat-filled "pies" that are filling, flavorful, and tasty. Yummy tsatziki sauce to go with the food. The entrees are large enough to share.
author: Stanley C.

description:
split the falafel wrap. it's huge and delicious.
super nice staff.
cheap.
high end ginger ale.
the hot sauce is very hot.

hole in the wall that makes consistently yummy food.
author: El B.

description: A+ for service-- the guy is so nice and hospitable. The food was good too. So glad we happened to stumble on this place. We were hungry and this was the closest, quick to-go place in sight.
author: Val K.

description:
I work across the street and go here for lunch often. Fresh, filling, homemade and comforting. I'm allergic to gluten and eating here is no problem for me. I get falafel, hummus and rice or fries. Great prices and always delicious.

Ali Baba himself is incredibly sweet and friendly. Remembered me after one visit, let me pay the next time I came in when I forgot my wallet. Love supporting this small business!
author: Jessica S.

description: last night I stood outside this restaurant and watched 7 (!!!) rats crawl around on the floor and counter. Why has the health inspector not closed this place down yet?
author: Allison S.

description: Had the chicken sandwich (wrap) after an afternoon at Dolores park this past weekend and every time my stomach growls I yearn for Ali Baba's. If only this place was closer to me...
author: Jesse A.

description:
I think I ate a bad schwarma because now I falafel - #noodosisters on IG

Just kidding, the falafel here was falawesome... haha? 

Falafel Shawerma (4 stars) 
I went here on the SF Sidewalk Food Tour and we tried the falafel shawerma. Every falafel I have ever had has always been dry, and I believed that this was how falafels were. The falafel at Ali Baba's redefined my perception of how falafels should be, lightly crispy outside and moist inside. I would love to come back and try their other items!

No input on service or pricing since I tried this place while on a food tour.
author: Shirley Q.

description: There are two particularly great features about Ali Baba's Cave (ABC). The first is that it is open until 11pm. For some reason, the majority of the restaurants in the area have decided that shutting their doors at 10pm is a good plan. I'm glad that ABC has resisted that trend. The second is that their portions are large, and their food is good. In the arena of quick, filling, and reasonably priced meals, ABC stands toe-to-toe with the local burrito joints, and often emerges from the fray as the hummus-y champion. They make their falafels from scratch too, so if they're fresh they are amazing.
author: Guru K.

description:
Food tour!!!!!!! never been here before, but my dad has brought me a few Kebab and Shawarma plates.  It was nice to finally know where he got these wonderful delights.  Starting of with a fresh tabouleh salad.  For me I think the food was amazing!!! It is a must eat asap, They grill the falafel and lamb shawarma. The grill marks allows for a nice little texture and a smokey flavor on the soft wrap.  There is a slight heat that touches that back of your throat which does not over power the flavor of the wrap.  The falafel was surely fresh, crunchy and soft on the inside.  I am a tru carnivorous man at heart, but this meal surely gave a satisfying alternative.  

The atmosphere could do a little revamping, but it sure as hell does not take that much away from the flavor of the food and the great love placed in each wrap they made.  Must go back to this place!!!!
author: Richard G.

description:
This is my first restaurant review but this is an exceptional circumstance. I love the food at this place, they have amazing falafels but, DO NOT SIT IN THE CAVE!! I sat in the cave for about half an hour, eating and reading. A few hours later, once I was home, some really nasty bug bites appeared on my back and leg. I have about 5 bites and I'm terrified these are bed bug bites. I'm taking the necessary precautions because these do look like bed bug bites.
In conclusion, food is good but DO NOT SIT IN THE CAVE! And owners, please take care of the problem, this is unprecedented.
author: Liz G.

description:
Ali Baba's cave was exactly that. A cave. I stumbled across this place because I was very hungry one night and I thought I may as well give it a go. Dont forget, I usually go to a place twice to give the food a second opinion. But not this place. 

Atmostphere:

Pretty much non existent, its also very dark inside. Your typical grab-and-go type place. But hey, Il give you a point for at least keeping it remotely clean and having adequate space for people who dared to stay in. 1/5 stars.

Service: 
The guys were nice to talk to and were informative as well, so il give them points for that. Although, it was very funny trying to converse in different accents. 4/5 stars.

Food:

I ordered the chicken Kebab and a side of chips.

The chicken kebab I could see grilling on the side I knew for sure was over cooked and dry. I was right, my chicken was dry and I got to a point in the kebab where I thought 'ok, I cant do the rest. 

The chips were dry and not crispy enough and I can taste the deep fryer fat is not clean. Didnt finish these either.

2 Stars for me

Summary:

I guess this is your typical drunken-night-out type meal that Im sure you wouldnt mind having if you are on the booze. However, if you are looking for a quick bite, then maybe you might give this a pass. I will give them the benefit of the doubt and round up since you cant give one and a half stars on yelp. My verdict?

I would give this a pass if you are looking for a decent meal. However, if you are enjoying the night out with mates, then this could be just enough. 2 stars from me.
author: Darren P.

description: I got the chicken platter and swapped out the rice for falafel. I had a favorite falafel wrap place in college and this place comes close in terms of falafel. I also got the yellow dough wrap with lamb, rice and vegetable that was good. I don't remember the name even though the server politely explained to me what it was and how to say it! The service is awesome and the people who work there are very friendly. If I didn't live so far, I would be back here more often. I plan on going back to try their falafel wraps (sandwiches).
author: Alice L.

description: I love this place for what it is: a wonderful neighborhood spot to grab a quick bite from really friendly people. The prices are very reasonable and the portions are generous. On top of that I think they make the best falafel in the city. I'm lucky to have this place down the street.
author: John S.

description:
In the style of Yelp Elite Event Master Attendee Eugene L... 

On my continuous quest for the perfect falafel wrap, I hit up Ali Baba's Cave. I was able to stash my work whip across the street in a metered spot. I street hiked to Ali Baba's and grabbed my deluxe falafel wrap.

The taste of the falafel balls were hard to distinguish from the rest of the wrap. I picked some out to sample. They weren't anything special but they complimented the rest of the wrap quite well. The overall flavor was good but not enough to bump it up to #1 on my falafel list. What was keeping it from perfection may have been the dryness of it all put together. A little more hummus and this thing woulda been nearly perfect. Oh, and while I could see that parts of my wrap had been stained red by the hotsauce, I couldn't really taste it. Since I'm seeking perfection here, I would prefer more girth than length (get your mind outta the gutter folks lol) when it comes to the size of the wrap. Trying to down this bad boy whole, it nearly broke in half since it wasn't cut to begin with.

Ali Baba's has one of the tastier wraps I've eaten. I'll definitely be back once I see what the other Falafel shops in The City have to offer.

I jumped in my whip and rolled out to the sweet sounds of Estereo Sol *bum bum ba ba ba bump* courtesy of 98.9 FM...
author: John B.

description: My friend and I stumbled upon this hole in the wall late at night after having realized we had not eaten dinner yet.  We both ordered falafel sandwiches, which were chock-full of vegetables such as fried egg plant, potato, onions, and cucumber salad.  The sandwiches must've weighed 5 pounds each, because they were huge.  Definitely yummy and satisfying.  I would have given more stars if the place were cleaner.  I was little concerned by how the person making the sandwich went to the stockroom to get something and came back to continue making sandwiches without washing his hands first.
author: Amelia S.

description:
Ali Baba's Cave is a comfortable place, I had the chance to eat there with a friend of mine and both were agreed that the food was great; beside the people working in there are friendly and asking you all the time if you need something. When you get there ask for the special of the day, and if you like it you won't spend much money, in fact you can eat there with $12.00 or more but it is an affordable place.

I am picky eating food,  but in here you can choice your place with no problems.
author: Eduardo S.

description: Great food for a pretty decent price! The super falafel wrap is HUGE and filling for two. This place is good for vegetarians and non-vegetarians :)
author: Alene R.

description: Wow I'm not a big fan of lamb but the the lamb and beef shawerma was so good I had a side of mojjadara with mine and it was delicious. It was my 1st time here the girl behind the counter was very nice and recommended what dishes to get and try out. I definitely recommend this spot
author: Josh R.

description: Best falafel anywhere.  Get the super falafel which is filled with lots of stuff.  Can't find one like this anywhere else.  Been coming here for many many years.  And now that I don't live in the city, I still come back here every time I'm in SF.
author: Janie H.

description: The falafel wrap is delicious. It's slightly spicy and they add eggplant to it which gives the overall flavor a unique flavor. I've had countless falafel sandwiches, and I have to say, I really enjoyed this one. It's authentic and very similar to something you'd get in the streets of Egypt.
author: Farida C.

description:
Falafel sandwich! Yeah yeah it's right around the corner from my house but for $6, you get a huge falafel sammi wrapped up in this lavash style bread. Big enough for two meals for me. I usually get mine without potato and with hot sauce, eggplant available for small up charge . Solid every time.

tahini sauce includes a mix of cucumbers and tomatoes, which was a downer for one of my friends... and sometimes I think it could be more fresh. overall food is inexpensive and reliable in a pinch.  I do wish the sandwiches had hummus too but they do have a lot of actual falafel in them.
author: Coco J.

description:
Great falafel's! Fresh and pipping hot!

The staff is friendly and they have some great vegetarian options!
author: Rachael S.

description:
Pretty decent falafel, at a good price. It's not the best I've had in SF, but it's a super big wrap. Surprisingly, I think I enjoyed the tabouleh more than the falafel. There's not usually a ton of variation with tabouleh, but somehow it tasted fresher and more flavorful at Ali Baba's.

I will say the people who work there are very friendly and the place has a good vibe. If I was looking for something quick in the area, I'd definitely come again.
author: Jon T.

description: I love them so much, reasonable priced, being for over 30-40 years in the neighborhood, always clean and delicious ! :D
author: Betty A.

description:
Best french fries in the city! Been getting them for more than a decade and you get a full paper bag of them for a great price!

Their super falafel is huge, fresh and delicious! enough to share with a friend! be sure to get the amazing eggplant and fries!!! some of the best hummus in the City!

have always had outstanding customer service here, but I'm also friendly!

I'm proud to support the affordable places in this new world of $30 small plates and ensure other working class people and artists still have a place to eat out too! thanks ali baba!!!
author: shanestar h.

description:
All I have to say is DRY! 

oh..and the bread fell apart.
author: Jaylena P.

description: All the creamy maza (hummus, baba ganoush, etc.) were way too sour for us! Friendly service and good wraps.
author: E L.

description:
Bathroom stop from people that need to use it - they are nice enough to let people use their single bathroom.

I was a bit hungry, not starving.

NO Lentil Soup!  So bummed.

I got a Mezza platter 3 items of my choice for $5.99 or so.  I picked Baba Ghanoush; Domas; Tabbouleh.  Baba ghanoush was a bit smoky, but why was it white?  Domas are 4 vegetarian (no meat) grape leaves filled w/ rice), 2 pita.  Tasted ok.

Chicken shawerma looked good, maybe next time I'll try it.

Got tap water.

I wanted to sit in the Red Curtain cove, but it was filled with people.

Charged it!
author: Ann L.

description: Just your friendly neighborhood falafel place. Good food. Great attitudes. Support them!
author: Jack H.

description: Adorable. Seems like a family-owned place, which is kind of amazing in San Francisco. The staff is always kind and the owner is always friendly too. Makes a customer feel appreciated. It is a little old and could use some serious cleaning and remodeling but...it's the only place on Valencia that I know of that can buy a whole meal for less than $10. I imagine there is some correlation there. Keep up the good work, guys!
author: Kristin H.

description:
I'm in the middle of the worst Chicken Shawarma ever.

The sauce is gross, the chicken is way over seasoned.

All around nasty.
author: Daniel S.

description: Went in to this place with my family, lets just say I will NEVER step foot in here. It smells weird, the seats are disgusting and looks like they have been there for years. None of the tables are clean, you can see dust and crumbs everywhere. Service is terrible, completely terrible. Requested baklava, told us they had them. We were sitting for thirty minutes, until we went up there and asked them about our baklava, which then they told us they didn't have. Food was really bad, we got the shish kebab platter which was gross, and the falafels were HARD, not crispy and not to mention they were completely cold. Can we pleas get a better falafel place?
author: Tahima B.

description:
As a kid, my family had Mediterranean restaurants. I grew up eating a wide variety of food, but I had yet to find falafel as good as I remembered until I ate here. 

The love and care they put in the food is obvious during the preparation. 

Vegan options are stellar. They are very accommodating.
author: Nina B.

description: Great shawarmas!
author: Peter K.

description: Owner's a prick.  Came in, asked for 1/3 hummus, 2/3 tabbouleh. Wouldn't do it even though they cost the same. I said they've done it before. He wanted to know which employee had done that. I wouldn't tell him because it felt like he was going to punish them.  I told him that and because i wouldn't tell him he then wouldn't even sell me just a side of tabbouleh " because it was under the $6 card limit " even though I offered to pay an extra fifty cents as is customary. He was ready to sell it to me until I wouldn't help him get an employee in trouble.  Gross.  As far as food quality goes, it's average for San Francisco middle eastern food.
author: Justin L.

description: Amazing dolmas, very yummy falafel. A great spot for a quick bite or grab and go. Large portions.
author: Kelly C.

description: Since there is not one restaurant in Sacramento that serves fresh falafel, I drive all the way from Sacramento to eat fresh falafel here.  It is well worth the drive.  The staff are friendly and the food is great.  I REALLY ENJOY THE FOOD.
author: Jackie L.

description: Really tasty Mediterranean spot with great big heaping portions for totally reasonable prices. I had the lamb shawarma plate and a a Snapple for under $15 and I was absolutely stuffed afterwards. The food was prepared within 5 minutes, so that was another huge plus. The only real downside to this place is the atmosphere, which could really stand an upgrade. If you're looking to grab a quick bite by yourself or with a friend, this a is a reasonable choice... but I certainly wouldn't come with a group or for anything special. I'd absolutely consider coming back if I find myself in the area.
author: Phillip K.

description: Went here on a Mission food walking tour. To be fair I am not a big fan of falafel which is one of their specialties. Place is dated and in serious need of a makeover.. falafel with hummus was decent but not something I would crave.
author: Joe M.

description:
My wife and I have given Ali Baba's Cave a few tries because we love Falafel, but each time we have found ourselves not feeling so well afterwards.  The last straw was my wife being awakened in the middle of the night feeling nauseous and then vomiting until the sunrise.   

Needless to say we have stopped eating there.  

This is the only restaurant I have ever given a single star, as I usually do not believe in casually handing out the best or the worst for anything, but finding ourselves continuously getting ill deserved the worst rating.
author: Sean K.

description:
Ali Baba open sesame! I want another kebab from here. A lamb or chicken wrap would be perfect too. 

This place has a homey feel to it. You walk inside and the food is spread out in front of you behind Glass windows. All the dishes are prepared to order and they put some terrific sauce inside the wraps. 

There's also a quintassential cave behind the cash register that's connected to the rest of the seating area. Most importantly, the food is excellent here. You pay for what you get and it's a good value compared to other places to grab lunch nearby on Valencia st. 

Ali Baba's is a staple for lunch time. Great food here.
author: Maximilian R.

description:
I went here when we couldn't find seats at Truly Mediterranean (http://www.yelp.com/biz/0QydZwQebF1b36i9OwHppA).

DECOR: Kind of an ugly place.  While they have a decent size seating area, perhaps this is more of a carryout place.  Their traditional sitting area they created in a corner is unappealing.   

FOOD:  Their Shawerma Platter ($8.95), with chicken and turkey, was pretty good; however, I think their Sharwerma sandwich ($5.99) is a better deal for the buck.  The sandwich was huge!  I felt that their food was a bit too salty.  

Pretty good inexpensive Middle Eastern fix when you are in Mission.  Next time, I would rather drive a bit more and eat at Goood Frikin' Chicken (http://www.yelp.com/biz/8TSk-heAZkXC2vO0yV0CQg).
author: トモ T.

description:
I ordered a falafel wrap here and the service was friendly and nice.  However, they always seem to automatically charge an extra 50 cents for extras I did not have added.  I have corrected them every time at the register!

The falafel wrap was, like one person recently mentioned, too acidic with its sauce - too much vinegar.  The potatoes add nothing really.  I have had much much better falafels, and the best was at Falafel King in Westwood, Los Angeles.
author: Richard R.

description: The servers are very nice and I love the look of the place -- they play super-cool Middle Eastern music that you can tap your toes to while you wait. I ordered the lamb shawerma and it was big enough that I could save half for dinner. Would definitely recommend this place for lunch!
author: Evie O.

description:
Leftovers.

Thanksgiving dinner featuring turkey, cranberry, stuffing and pumpkin pie.

Day after Thanksgiving lunch featuring Ali Baba's special wrap with chicken and turkey, chopped vegetables and hummus.

Both were large enough to have leftovers. Thanksgiving lasted three days. Ali Baba's was so good it was finished in one.

Confirms what I discovered at their now closed Haight location few years back (http://www.yelp.com/biz/ali-babas-cave-san-francisco-2#hrid:N7u-6IiusD8J2_NK9gdYqQ), this is one of the best wraps in the city.
author: Jason B.

description:
Hole in the wall great find along Valencia! I was a bit skeptical coming in, but we thought why not. The spot looked fairly small, but they had enough seating for a good amount of people.  My date and I were the only ones there so we ended up taking prime location of their "cave" consisting of a round table close to the ground with seating all around it.  We waited for our dinner platters of chicken and lamb kebabs for a good amount of time, but its fair to say that the wait was not in vain.  The food was pretty amazing with generous portions.  
The only thing that was a turn off to me was the bathroom.  It was more or less a cluster fuck of gaudy tags, graffitis, and a bunch of random storage items that should be put away.  I'm no clean freak, but i really wanted to just de-clutter the bathroom. 
I guess for the most part, I would just go back for take out rather than actually dining in.  At least you know I would def. go back. :)
author: Melanie D.

description: I never do this but F this place.   I ordered 2 falafels and was then charged $4 more for super falafels.   I told the owner that he overcharged me and he said "sorry, we already made it".  He refused to let me pay for what I ordered.  I walked away with the incorrect order.  My girlfriend nicely asked for a free drink to make up for the price difference.  He basically laughed and walked away.  I then took a bite and the falafel was ok.  Not too happy about paying an extra $2 per sandwich for just some eggplant.   Horrible customer service.
author: Patrick Q.

description:
Dropped in here right before heading to Amnesia.

I must say, while I haven't had Falafel in ages, it was so yummy I'm positive I would come back in a second.

We ended up splitting the regular (apparently the only difference between the super and regular is the super comes with eggplant) and asked for light spice. They even cut it in half for us to easily eat, which we did, standing up ;)

Yummy, filling and not hard on the stomach, it even had the added bonus of being easy on the wallet as well.

Mmm saysame.
author: Meg T.

description: 5 years later and the prices have gone up and the quality has gone way way down. The wraps are no where nearly as big as they used to be. Some of the nice little trimmings are now an additional charges (ie eggplant). The falafel maintains a good flavor, but the shwerma is a mere shadow of what it was 5 years ago. I don't think that they use lamb anymore. The old meat was so juicy, tender, and bursting with flavor in every bite that Ali Baba's Cave should be ashamed of itself for serving anything less.
author: Brandon D.

description: The most authentic falafel wraps I've ever had in the States.  They cram them full of french fried potatoes, charred eggplant, hummus, tahini, mediterranean salad, and spicy sauce just like they do in the middle east.  I still go here every time I'm back in SF and need a quick, filling lunch.
author: Roni F.

description:
Just like the Batman movies had to come to an end with the last installment of the trilogy, so too is the food quality Ali Baba's Cave. The cobwebs seems to be filling up the Cave with no one cleaning them. I went with the BF on a Friday evening for a pre-dinner snack. We ordered the chicken shawerma sandwich and the falafel sandwich. Portions remain huge - not losing a single inch in size - but ingredients have taken a hit. The falafels were cold and stale as opposed to pipingly crispy. The optional "french fries" inside the sandwiches were similarly cold and soggy. Even the fried eggplant, which essentially vegetable drenched in hot oil, was lackluster. 

To add to the cave experience, the seats looked as if they had years of dirt and grime caked on. I can't say I'll ever sit on one of the cushions for fear of contracting a disease from the 1990s.
author: Gwen L.

description:
I love the shawarmas at Ali Baba's Cave! Nuff said. 

Alright, here's a little more. It's so much flavor for your dollar. The shawarmas are large things chocked full of delicious ingredients. My lamb was so tender and tasty. Coupled with the hummus, veggies, and french fries, you have one very substantial meal to-go. 

As good as the lamb was, the falafel wrap totally stole the show! They honestly have some of the best falafel in the city! Absolutely delish and at just the right texture and consistency. Each bite is tasty and hearty so much so that you won't notice it's missing meat. 

And to top it all off, it's fast service and the meal prep area is extremely clean. Ali Baba's Cave is a go-to Mediterranean stop in the Mission.
author: Jon L.

description: Chicken Shawarma here is some of the best in the city. Coupled with the hummus & tahini platter is a good combination for the middle eastern palette that you must entertain from time to time.
author: Sven S.

description: I was really happy to discover that there is still an affordable restaurant that is good on Valencia Street in San Francisco these days. Ali Baba has been a staple for years, and it is full of regulars, not the gentrified cocktail and tapas crowd. Felt like a little bit of home and friendliness held over from the '90's before the all-good aspect of SF was dot-commed out of existence. .
author: J p.

description: Rating this place is easy. Four stars! The food is inexpensive, delicious, and served generously. I particularly liked the baba ganoush, though everything I tasted was pretty good. The staff was super friendly and treated us like friends, and the alcove in the back was a cozy place to sit with a group of friends and hang out over pita and hummus. I will be back, probably more than a few times. I am a sucker for good baba ganoush.
author: Christopher L.

description: Awesome service, great/airy atmosphere, and their falafel sandwich was quite juicy and crisp! Also, a very non-pretentious vibe, which is refreshing, especially in the Mission!
author: William B.

description: Stood in front of the counter waiting for the girl to take my order for 15 minutes while she put away waters then walked away without asking if I needed anything. Worst customer service I've seen in San Francisco
author: Amber L.

description: I love their shawarmas! The flavors and combinations are delicious. To be fair I have only ever had the lamb or chicken shawarma, but every time we stop by I can't help but order it again! Any time I'm bumming around in the Mission I love to come here to grab some food and take it to Dolores Park.
author: Kaitlin T.

description:
This place is for the person that likes it the same way every time....same ol same ol. You know; creatures of habit, you know who you are....this is right up your alley. The falafel and hummus were yummy. Don't attempt to modify your order, cause it ain't happenin. 
I do have to give them 5 stars for the baklava- it was Legit!
author: Ladybird G.

description:
It was getting late, and other places in the Mission were getting too crowded so my friend and I just decided to get food to-go from Ali Baba's and head over to her place.

We both got the super falafel, which consists of a long flat bread swathed in hummus, tahini, eggplant, fries, "cucumber salsa," and their house-made falafel. Their falafel was decent: crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, jam-packed with flavorful spices, not too dry. But I must say that it wasn't the absolute best falafel that I have ever had. The "sandwich" comes out to be pretty large though, and the guy toasts it over a grill. This ended up serving two meals for me so it could have ended up being shared by two girls.
author: Jane K.

description: This place is truly a deal for vegetarians especially, but meat eating shawarma heads like myself as well. Their sauce and fixings really are unique - who puts French fries in a Greek wrap? It's a great place for buying a meal for now and one for later before going to lay in the crowds of Delores Park. Spicy delicious chicken shawarma, almost to the extreme. Not the greatest store ambience but a really friend,y and remarkable staff.
author: Seanessy G.

description: Reasonable entry to an informal bite on Valencia deep in the Mission. Great location on the corner, bike parking right in front, easy to order without huge crowds or lines, get in and out quickly, takes credit card payment. Under $10 you get an awesome falafel sandwich wrap and a bottled drink. Sizeable and filling, and the french fries appease the frites-in-my-burrito "California" novelty.
author: Wilson T.

description: food is great, customer service suck don't speak english, & for what ever you do dont order through grubhub they claim they dont receive your order then you have to reorder when you get there. im done coming here period, get your stuff right before you serve people!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Tyler F.

description: I love this place...their schawarmas are the best in the bay area! Fresh and healthy...I try to come here at least once a week....love it!!!
author: Monica G.

description: Hot slightly spicy a salty sweet hummus dolma taste fresh green chicken swarma a meal that will fill you up for the day.
author: Muerto D.

description: OMG based God, thank god for this place.  I've been going to this place for over a decade and it's the best falafel in the world. Those of you giving the place suspect reviews because of the meat, well, that's what u get for eating shady meat on a pole you know what I'm saying?
author: Dawnes J.

description:
This place is an ok place to get a quick bite to eat at a cheap price. The Lamb shwarma itself is nothing that special, its awesome because of the huge portions but other than that the meat was slightly dry and flavorless. What makes this place get a 3 stars is their cucumer sauce. Its refreshing and tasty! 

Would I come back, Yes if im super broke and hungry.
prices 7-12 shwarmas are around 7.
author: Reiko n.

description:
A dirty place. Every table was dirty and hadn't been bussed. Every single one...

The women making the food was unhelpful and borderline rude.  She should be sent to charm school. 

The food was mediocre and greasy. 

Never eating here again.
author: Jim O.

description:
I have loved going to this place occasionally for a while. This time, I called and asked if they will deliver a party tray, and I said it was just 5 blocks away. I knew they didn't do regular delivery, but I thought a big tray might be different. They said sure, and I gave them my credit card on the phone and asked to be charged now, for delivery.

This was to be a delivery to some friends, as a thank-you for their help to fix my computer.  It was a surprise. I knew they would like it, because there's 9 of them in a collective-living-working situation, and there's always hungry, busy people there.

30 minutes after the time I gave Ali Baba's, I was heading for BART to meet my girlfriend, when they called asking where was I to pick up? I explained that there must be some mistake, but they would not deliver.

I was in a hurry and biked there to pick up. The party tray was a flimsy plastic thing, that wanted to cave in when I picked it up, with the weight of the food inside.  It would have broken in half if I tried to wheel it home on my bike. It would have been OK with a box. I asked for a box and they said they didn't have one, with a bit of attitude.

I wasted 10 min running across street to beg for a box. When I got back, they magically had found one. It was such a waste of time. 

I can understand if there might have been miscommunication on the phone (and told them so), but then when they gave me attitude about something as simple as finding a box, that was ridiculous.  

I was in a rush when they called me and wasted my time. This experience soured the nice surprise I was trying to give my friends. But the party tray of hummus, falafel and tabbouleh was very well received.  For that and many previous good experiences, I'll refrain from giving 1 star- but it's rare that a place pisses me off like this one did.
author: Pat L.

description: i LOVE the felafel wraps here. sometimes i wish i could order something new, but the felafel is too delish to look away from :)
author: Belle P.

description:
I'm a bit stumped per my review when it comes to this place. Why, you ask? 

Because the food was okay, the portions were huge, the prices were great and the wait was non-existent. But the woman behind the counter? Man, she was just plain irritating. 

I'm not even sure that she means to be rude, or if she just doesn't know how to be anything but. And when people are as surly and as bland as the woman behind Ali Baba's counter, it makes me pretty uneasy. 

But I tried it anyway -- we were hungry and we wanted Mediterranean food, damn it! -- and all in all it was pretty mediocre. 

On a high note, the hummus was amazing. 

On a low note, the beef was burnt. 

Another high note,  I liked the spicy sauce. 

Another low note, the falafel was tasteless.

In summation, if you're looking for something fast, cheap and easy this is your place. 

If you're looking to be super stoked on your awesome meal, keep on truckin'.
author: Mel H.

description:
This is a decent felafel place.
San Francisco, the mission especially, isn't short on these places so it's hard for one to stick out above the others.

There is a better felafel place a couple blocks away, so I wouldn't necessarily recommend going out of your way to this place.

While the wraps are large and the price is low, the quality isn't always there.
author: Ayall S.

description:
atmosphere= none (could use some music)
food= not good

i had the falafel and they were dry and tasteless
my friend had the lamb shwarma and he said even with all the sauce he had to pour on, he was greatful for the diet coke as a chaser
author: K R.

description:
Ummm... after riding my bike back and forth on valencia to find a quick Tuesday night snack I somehow settled for this place.  The word "cave" in the name might have scared off someone more observant than I, but somehow it didn't click.  

The vegetarian ojha was soldout, so I went for the veggie combination.  Perhaps the ojha was good, and that's why it was soldout... but I'm stuck reviewing the combination, which was...  um, way below par.  

Four parts to the dish, salad, composed of wilted lettuce.  Lentil + couscous mix, which was very dry, and tasted as though the lentils came straight from a can, without any kind of magical mixing.  The hummus was bland, and the forth part, parsley couscous tabouleh, was edible.  I did eat all of that, but it was really oily, and barely a 2star part of this illustrious meal.   

The pita bread was kinda edible, it wasn't *too* stale, it's that thin kind you get at cheaper falafel joints.  

The decor had potential, as you head inside, there is a back dining room with a little alcove, and low cushion seating.  It's decked out like a little ali baba tent in the desert you were hoping for or expecting.  But all the cushions are torn up and really worn, and I guess when the food sucks, you start to look at and criticize everything.
author: Sean S.

description:
Ordered my food to sit down at table,while waiting for my order the surroundings 
werent to clean,got wood slivers in my pants from wobbley broken down chairs,
and lastly saw a roach on floor coming from food counter area.Didnt eat my food
and just walked out as soon as i could.Good bye Ali Baba.......................!
author: Shelbyflf F.

description:
really great local find. thanks food tours! 

well homemade falafel (crispy and moist). huge sandwich was made with them and it was so well seasoned and cooked we had to take some home for later. great prices as well! ($7 for a falafel sandwich)

they are open 7 days a week. 11-11!!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
The one on Haight Street was better when it was open.

This one is so bland and mundane.
The Beef Shawerma taste like a carne asada burrito.

Where have the good times gone.
author: vin t.

description:
I really, really want to like this place more than I do. Sad face. It is ridiculously close to my house and has hearty falafal wraps for a decent price. However, I just find the wraps to be dry and underwhelming. 

Even when I get the "super sized" version with all the trimmings, there is still just something missing. I think I will give it another shot and ask them to jazz it up for me, but for now, I will stick with the sharwarma/falafal house on 16th between Valencia and Guerrero.
author: Shira O.

description:
I just had the best shish-kabob wrap from Ali Baba's. The chicken roasts on a spit all day and is really tender. Their sauce is a sort of mustard-tsatziki, it's completely delicious and potentially addicting. I wanted to order the lamb kabob, but they said it would take 15-20 minutes. Kind of a bummer. 

I would strongly recommend eating your order there, as it doesn't seem like they're able to wrap those things to make them leak-proof. Before I made it to 16th street BART, the kabobs had leaked through the wrapping, the bag, and down my hands. This might have been the messiest thing I have ever ate, but I loved every moment of it.

Just for fun: I am likely wasted every check-in here. Amazing drunk food, folks.
author: K M.

description: This place is amazing the food is really good and much healthier than most food places now days! For the price you pay here, you will not find a better and healthier eat out place! I would reconnect to try chicken Shish Kebab, it is very tasty and freshly cooked right in front of you! I would defiantly recommend Ali Baba cave to anyone and everyone that wants to get the best lunch for the buck!
author: Roman E.

description: Disgusting. Dirty. Without a doubt, the very worst example of Arabic food. Sick the next day. Not sure why this place hasn't been shut down by the health department.
author: Holly L.

description:
Went here for a pre-dinner meal!

Pros:
- Large portions!
- Got the falafel wrap - really crunchy falafels - they were not too dry which was great!
- The wrap has eggplant in it which really added to the flavors
- Baba Ganoush was fantastic - not very oily and not very smokey which I really liked!
- Side of cucumber yogurt was really refreshing
- Saw that they served Ginger Beer - looked interesting, although we didn't get it with our meal.

Cons:
- Friend got the Chocolate Chai and he didn't really enjoy it
- Filo Dough (Veggie) was a little dry
- Falafel wrap had french fries which were a little bland and not very crunchy (I didn't think it was necessary since there was already so many yummy things in the wrap)
- You go here to eat good food, not for the ambiance, however it was relatively clean.

Overall, this place is great if you're looking for a quick no-nonsense meal if you're in the Mission!
author: Vaibhavi U.

description: Wandering the streets of mission so much good food to chose from. My friend wanted to try this place we were thinking fast good food how can you go wrong with a shawarma? Ohh dang they did it, all I have to say is DRY DRY DRY!! All the meats were dried out from being precut and precooked, the potato in my chicken shawarma was dry and stale. My friend's steak was so dry and hard like beef jerkey. My other friend got this phyllo with rice and meat in it. That phyllo thing was dry and had a funky spice flavor. NO BUENO!!
author: Karen T.

description:
If I could give zero stars I would. I'm writing this review as I am still nauseous from the falafel wrap & veggie plate. I threw the entire order away due to practically chipping my tooth on a bone in the hummus. Which is especially disgusting to me because I am vegetarian. My boyfriend also found bone in his wrap. The tabouli & side salad were visibly wilted to the point that a respectable restaurant would never have served them. The falafel was cold & cracked & filled with over cooked nonsense like potatoes. I would NEVER eat here again. If we wouldn't have already ordered over the telephone I would have never eaten here in the first place because none of the food looked fresh. Another strong pre-indicator was the people serving the food, usually when I eat ethnic food it is served by someone of a similar ethnicity. Let's just say week old korean/middle eastern food is not for me.

On a positive note we called them & they agreed to refund our money, which is nice that they are admitting that they serve shitty unsanitary food but it does nothing for my nausea.
author: Paulette B.

description: The hearty falafel are tasty alone and quite good in a wrap, despite being cooked in advance and a tad dry at times.  Avoid the shawarma -- it is generally cooked to all hell, plus fifteen minutes.  Come here for the falafel and you will be satisfied, most of the time.
author: Vin J.

description:
Whhoooaa... Totally found this place by accident.

It was GDC week and I was guiding a bunch of Scandinavians through the Mission to get some vegetarian sushi at Cha-Ya, which turned out wasn't going to be open for another hour.

Fortunately we found this place instead and it was probably even better. There were about 8 of us and everyone but one person ordered the same thing; the super falafel wrap. It's falafel, potatoes fried to perfection, sauteed eggplant, hummus, and yogurt with cucumber and tomato, rolled up in a wrap with herbs and spicy sauce.

The roll itself was massive; over a foot long. I've seriously never saw any cylindrical food object this long before. Only a few of us were able to finish the entire thing, and it could have easily been two meals if cut in half. And this thing, which was pretty much TWO entire meals in one hand-held wrap was under $7?? Incredible.

If I lived in this neighborhood I would be eating here at least every other day. 500 stars.
author: P A U L.

description: This place is great! The a super Falafel is where it is at. Best in the city. Get it extra crispy and spicy!
author: paul s.

description: been going here for over 10 years and it is still the best. falafel wrap or meat wrap or veggie combo -- all super tasty. friendly service too  Mr. Hussein is very hard working and friendly.
author: J R.

description:
Ok, during my last visit to SF, I tried the other Ali Babas and was blown away, though admittedly my taste buds may have been impaired, so this time around I had to give it another shot.  This location is definitely a little bit cleaner than the other location which is a plus.  

The food was just as amazing.  The large falafel wrap was awesome and I also had some really tasty grape leaves this time around.  It is also super cheap.  I really wish they had a location some 2000 miles east for me.
author: Jason P.

description:
Meh.  Everything in this place is dripping with grease.  The falafel sandwiches, the shawermas...they're soooooo greasy.  Middle Eastern food isn't supposed to be like this, not even Middle Eastern fast food.  Last time I had the lamb shawerma wrap my plate after eating less than half the wrap my plate was swimming in grease...and so were my pants.  This place is disgusting.

Interior is dirty too.  On the upside, the portions are huge and mad cheap.  But you get what you pay for.  I couldn't finish less than half and didn't see myself wanting to save the rest.  So it went away.
author: David A.

description:
Ali Baba's Cave: home to the most unique & varied falafel I've ever had the pleasure of consuming. 

My past encounters with falafel, though delicious, have been fairly straightforward: pita, falafel balls, sauce, and maybe some lettuce and tomato.

The ABC falafel? Falafel balls, eggplant, hummus, hot sauce, tahini salad, onions, and maybe something else I'm forgetting all rolled up in a giant piece of lavosh (unleavened tortilla-like bread). 

Aside from being delicious, the falafel wrap is big enough to make two to four meals out of, depending on how hungry you are/how much restraint you're able to exercise.  Also, it's about $6. I'm a big fan of stretching my dollars (I'm currently living in SF & working as an unpaid intern), and this is a tasty and economical respite from PB&J.
author: Stacey L.

description: Check out the shag room in the back of the restaurant.  The food aint half bad, but the shag room is amazing.
author: Nicole R.

description: Absolutely awesome shawarma! Alibaba just opened and I've gone in multiple times every week, all the guys go above and beyond to make you affordable, delicious food. If you go in once, you'll keep coming back. Try everything, it's all fantastic!
author: Max A.

description: You know upon coming here more times after writing it off a while back , its vastly improved and I prefer it over Truly Med even. You get more of a choice and variety in dishes , and the quality of the food feels more traditional . Truly Med is like a middle eastern burrito joint, whereas this is actually a Middle Eastern restaurant. If I were the owners though I'd maybe think about getting some new furniture , a lot of tables are wobbly and old.
author: Lauren V.

description: About an hour after eating Ali Baba's Cave, I found myself glued to a toilet with worst case of food poisoning I've ever experienced. No bueno. Don't eat here...
author: Caroline C.

description: Great delicious mediterranean food at affordable prices. I give falafel here a 10 on 10. The sandwiches/ wraps are amazingly mouth watering
author: Mary M.

description: People say their falafels are great, but I found it average. Their menu also had less selections, though vegetarians might like it better. There is a small cave like area which they call Ali Baba's cave.
author: Mia C.

description:
When Ali Baba stopped serving lamb a while ago I stopped going, as lamb shwarma was my favorite thing, I was so sad,  now they have added lamb back to the menu, so I decided to give it a try and see if it was still as good as I remembered:

All of the same flavors are there, which is good, but wheres the lamb??!  Its mostly beef, DO NOT be fooled!  I would venture to say 20% or less. I didn't ask for a beef shawarma!   Mean trick Ali Baba, I won't be back....
author: Molly M.

description:
I've gone here twice.

Both times I got the supreme falafel wrap with everything - yes to fries, yes to eggplant, yes to spicy sauce! Grilled perfectly with warm, crispy lavash.  I go with a huge appetite and barely finish - and I eat a lot. Seriously, share with a friend or be prepared to take home for later.

I've left full, happy, and looking forward to returning each time. 

Hmmm, I may go raid my wife's leftover wrap right now.
author: Cameron M.

description: This was the best falafel I have ever had. Seriously delicious. You'll miss the "cave" if you don't visit the back of the restaurant so stay awhile and get comfy.
author: Justin Y.

description: The falafel is to diiee for !!!! Usually with beef shawarma I can only stomache so much before the astringent odor of lamb over whelms my tAste buds but this shawarma mix was light and very tasty. But seriously falafel is just incredible
author: Zaarah A.

description:
When I first tried this place, I immediately got hooked on their ginormous shawermas.  Subsequent visits, however, have been disappointing because they are very restrictive on adding other ingredients to the shawerma, such as grilled eggplant.  Recently, they actually stopped making/offering grilled eggplant.  What is a shawerma without grilled eggplant?  Not much of much, in my opinion...hence the 2 stars.  

I prefer going to the other previous location on Haight, and although they have changed ownership, the food is still the same there, with grilled eggplants.
author: V B.

description:
Amaaaaazing food!

Wonderful greeting of the customer with a smiling face.

Huge portions and reasonable price.

I had Chicken Shish with delicious hummus included in the platter. Couldn't be happier. Two huge skewers of chicken!

Head to Ali Baba instead of Rhea market who makes sandwiches accross the street. They're pricey and rude. Ali Baba is great!
author: D T.

description:
Was walking up Valencia on a run for Tartine as was starving mid-afternoon.  Just as we passed 19th and Valencia we both stopped and were like, what's that smell.  A step back revealed the magic word "falafel" on the overhang.  Tartine was instantly forgotten and we were drawn into Ali Baba's on a tractor beam.

Have only tried the falafel sandwich which contains thick cut skin on french fries and eggplant as well as the usual hummus, parsley, yogurt cucumbers, etc.  One sandwich for $5 can feed two for a snack.  it's like the giant burritos in the Mission but long and skinny instead.  After putting the sandwich together it's grilled so the wrap is all nice and crispy.

One of the best falafels I've had (scores up there with the stand in Borough Market, LDN) and certainly nicer than most kebab places in London though it's still not what I would call a restaurant.
author: Jean K.

description:
This place is now under new management.

The food is still really good but the new folks behind the counter are clueless about how to move the line.  Perhaps I just happened to be one of the first people through with the new staff?  The chicken shawarma and falafel sandwiches IMHO are exceptional.
author: Neil A.

description: The lamb ozhi is one of my favorites. I think they only have it on the weekend. I come here about once a month for the last four years. The veggie platter is also great, the highlight being the mojadarra. The portions are huge, the prices are good, the staff are very friendly and the atmosphere is relaxing.
author: Miles R.

description:
5 for value
3 for taste

Alright for $6 you got a huge ol' wrap. I got a veggie wrap that they loaded with hummus, babaganouesh, eggplant, hot sauce, onions, tomatoes, tabouli, etc. It was more than I could eat and like I said awesome value.

The quality of the food was good but nothing exceptional. The flavor combos worked pretty well and I wasn't disappointed.

When in the Mission and I'm not in the mood for a burrito this as good a place as any to get filled up for cheap.
author: J. S.

description:
It was a daaaarrrk and stormy night (ok, it was a sunny Sunday afternoon, but that's a boring way to start a review) when I first traipsed into Ali Baba's Cave. 

After admiring the stalactites of meat roasting on their spickets (new word, I just made it up), I decide to get - you guessed it - the salad platter. (Gee, you're smart.) And, I bet you can guess what I got on my salad platter as well. Mhhmmm, that's right - baba ganoush, dolmas, and a lentil/rice mix - oh, and small a zebra named Fred . All of it was tasty (don't worry, I didn't really eat Fred), but the baba ganoush really knocked my socks off. (I still haven't found them. If find them, let me know.)  

And, it was reasonable - my platter was, I think $6.

My friends had the:
1) Veggie Ohzi - Complex flavors, but not strong flavors. Interesting. Mmm filo dough.
2) Chicken Shwarma - My friend says it was good, but a bit dry.

So to recap, I liked my food a lot, especially the baba ganoush, and think this place is a good option for a tasty, reasonable, quick meal.

And, that's all, Folks!
author: Hannah R.

description:
I hate this place! I have either consistently been bummed out or just fully thrown my meal away - how can hummus be gross!?

Three strikes you're out, Ali Baba. Cave indeed.
author: Stephanie P.

description: I have been in this place several times. The food is ok for the price. However, every time I come here, I always get turned off by the attitude of the people behind the counter. No sense of customer service, no smiles and every extra things you ask is met with a frown. I will NEVER come back again to this place! So many other options in the city.
author: Chat V.

description:
My husband and I ate here for lunch.

Service was just ok.
Portions were generous.
Food
-I had the chicken shawarma plate.  The chicken was dry and had an odd taste.  
-My husband had the lamp shawarma plate.  This definitely tasted better than the chicken.

We will most likely not return.
author: Tina C.

description:
I grew up eating Middle Eastern food from family, so I rarely go out to eat it. We originally had our eyes set on another restaurant but since they decided to close early without any notice we were stuck with driving around the Valencia area.

Parking was easy. It was around 8pm. You order at the front, pay, sit and they bring you your food. They accept debit/credit for all the people who forget to bring cash. 

The rest of my family ordered Falafel and Shawarma plates, but I decided to go with a Super falafel sandwich. WRONG IDEA. It wasn't your typical pocket falafel. It was more like a wrap and they didn't use Pita bread. Glad the rest of my family had big plates and there was plenty to go around. The food was reasonably priced.
I guess it depends on how you like your falafel. The plates were big and yummy for the price. 

The inside is what you get for the price as well. It's cold in there and really run down. I would make it a quick lunch only if I was in the area but wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Sarina I.

description: so good! love this place live a block away great cheap food. i always get a falafle wrap extra spicy, and its spicy! ha but its a solid 2 meals for 7$ can't be beat
author: Tiffany C.

description: I don't even really like Mediterranean food.  Or, I didn't.  But then I had the chicken schwarma sandwich.  So good, so massive.  I don't even really know how to explain the flavors.  Visually, it presents as burrito-like.  I rarely venture into the Mission, but for this sandwich I would.
author: Nora S.
